medical_history.chief_complaint: Ms. A presented with preoccupation regarding vascular markings on her nose, which she believed made her unattractive.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began shortly after Ms. A got married and graduated from law school. Initially, she used make-up to cover the imagined defect and avoided mirrors. Although she exhibited no vegetative symptoms of major depression, she felt demoralized. After treatment, her outlook improved, but following an incident of seeing herself without make-up, her overvalued belief developed into a delusional certainty, requiring additional treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of obsessive-compulsive disorder in family members, particularly her sister who has classic obsessions and compulsions.
medical_history.family_history: Clear family history of obsessive-compulsive disorder; her sister has classic obsessions and compulsions regarding contamination and fears exposure of radiation to her family.
